intro: Gymnosporia serrata var. niansaica, commonly known as the Yunnan thornapple, is a shrub native to China, particularly in Yunnan Province. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of xerophytic flora.
